description: The eapd program contains multiple buffer overflow vulnerabilities: 1) The main network processing function (fcn.0000bd88) uses a fixed-size buffer (0xff0 bytes) to receive network data without adequate length checks; 2) The data processing function (fcn.0000b568) directly copies network data to an internal buffer using memcpy without length validation; 3) Multiple dangerous functions (strcpy, sprintf, etc.) are used. Attackers could potentially trigger buffer overflows by sending specially crafted network packets, leading to arbitrary code execution.

The EAPD program lacks sufficient input validation when processing network data, particularly when handling MAC addresses and interface names. Attackers could potentially inject malicious data or trigger abnormal behavior by forging packets.
The EAPD program uses a fixed-size hash table (0x80 entries) to store client information, which may lead to a denial-of-service attack. When the table is full, new client connections may be rejected.
